summary: The Migratory Bird Protection Act of 2025 amends the Migratory Bird Treaty Act to clarify that the prohibition on taking migratory birds includes incidental take. It directs the Secretary of the Interior to authorize such incidental take through regulations, including permit issuance, and sets civil penalties for violations. The bill establishes a Migratory Bird Recovery Fund, authorizes appropriations, mandates reports to Congress on bird conservation, and establishes a research program. It also defines key terms.
